Row.Text: Very well.
All right.
Certainly.
It is agreed.
Oh, very well.
I suppose I must.
Excellent.
You dare? We will crush you!
Villain! I shall hang your ugly head from my palace battlements for the pigeons to feast upon!
Fool! You shall regret this, I swear it!
You have abused our good nature for the last time! Prepare for war!
Your very existence is an offence to Heaven. Prepare for war, you nasty little barbarian!
The world will be a better place without you - prepare for war!
I am finished; do with me what you will. They will write epic poems of my great fall.
You have deprived the world of a great beacon of beauty and enlightenment. I hope you are satisfied.
You are victorious; I congratulate you. My palace is yours now: I hope that you will take good care of the peacocks.
Your existence offends me. I am inclined to be merciful - for a price.
My friend - will you not assist us in our hour of need?
If you wish to maintain your independence, I urge you to surrender to us the following.
No.
Certainly not.
We decline.
Of course not.
That's unacceptable.
You cannot be serious!
I beg your pardon?
Welcome! I am Harun al-Rashid of the Arabian people. Come - let us admire the sumptuousness of my palace!
Ah! A new star appears on the horizon. I am Harun al-Rashid of Arabia! I shall write an epic poem to celebrate our historic meeting!
Welcome, Stranger! I am Harun al-Rashid, ruler of Arabia. Come - tell me of your empire.
Good day.
Farewell.
Goodbye.
Until we meet again.
I must feed the peacocks. Go away now.
That is all.
Our business here is done.
Welcome.
Hello.
Greetings.
The Blessings of Heaven be on you!
Oh, it's you.
Well?
What do you want?
Go ahead.
Proceed.
I'm listening.
Yes?
You were saying?
And?
Go on.
I commend you on the generosity of your terms. You will not find us ungrateful
Come now - are you an enlightened ruler or greedy child crying for more sweets? Make me a better offer.
That's not good enough.
You must do better than that.
I cannot accept your offer as it stands, my friend; can you not improve it?
Is that the best you can do?
You're almost there…
We are the best traders in the world, you know. You cannot take advantage of us. Do you not care to improve your offer?
Can you do a little better?
That's not quite good enough.
Almost…
Were you dropped upon your head as a child? Your offer is outrageous.
Ask anything of me, my friend - anything! Except that.
I beg your pardon? Have you been drinking?
You are wiser than you appear. I agree.
I am amazed at your wisdom and acumen. Done.
Fair trade makes the world more beautiful. I agree.
Can I interest you in a trade? Your advisors can explain the details if it is too complex for you.
Let us trade, my friend: both of our peoples will be the better for it.
Come - let us do business!
You are an ugly, stupid person and your presence offends me. Go away now.
It is like a dagger in my heart, my friend, but I must refuse your request.
Never! We love peace, but we will defend our treasure and our honor with our lives!
Very well. A great civilization can afford to be charitable to its inferiors.
Why, certainly! One can afford to be generous when one is so magnificently wealthy!
Very well. I trust that you will remember our generosity in the future.
You are playing a dangerous game.
Very well. The next time I shall not be so polite!
How disappointing.
How very disappointing.
Indeed? I trust that you will not live to regret your short-sightedness.
How foolish of you.
All is right with the world once more. I hope you have learned your lesson.
